Package net.royalur.rules

Class RuleSet<P extends Piece,​S extends PlayerState,​R extends Roll>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.royalur.rules.RuleSet<P,​S,​R>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
    S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
    R - The type of rolls that may be made.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleRuleSet
    public abstract class RuleSet<P extends Piece,​S extends PlayerState,​R extends Roll>
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of rules that govern the play of a game of the Royal Game of Ur.

      • getIdentifier

        @Nonnull
public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Generates an identifier to identify this set of rules. This does not include identifying the board shape, path, or dice used.
        Returns:
        An identifier to identify this set of rules.

      • getDescriptor

        @Nonnull
public java.lang.String getDescriptor()
        Gets a descriptor that can be used to uniquely identify these rules, the board shape, the path, and the dice used.
        Returns:
        A descriptor to describe these rules, the board shape, the path, and the dice used.

      • findAvailableMoves

        @Nonnull
public abstract java.util.List<Move<P>> findAvailableMoves​(@Nonnull
                                                           Board<P> board,
                                                           @Nonnull
                                                           S player,
                                                           @Nonnull
                                                           R roll)
        Finds all available moves from the current state of the board and the player, and the roll that they made of the dice.
        Parameters:
        board - The current state of the board.
        player - The current state of the player.
        roll - The roll that was made. Must be non-zero.
        Returns:
        A list of all the available moves from the position.

      • applyRoll

        @Nonnull
public abstract java.util.List<GameState<P,​S,​R>> applyRoll​(@Nonnull
                                                                       WaitingForRollGameState<P,​S,​R> state,
                                                                       @Nonnull
                                                                       R roll)
        Applies the roll roll to the state state to generate the new state of the game. Multiple game states may be returned to include information game states for maintaining history. However, the latest or highest-index game state will represent the state of the game after the move was made.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game.
        roll - The roll that the player made.
        Returns:
        A list of new game states after the given move was made. The list may include historical information game states, and will always include the new state of the game as its last element.

      • applyMove

        @Nonnull
public abstract java.util.List<GameState<P,​S,​R>> applyMove​(@Nonnull
                                                                       WaitingForMoveGameState<P,​S,​R> state,
                                                                       @Nonnull
                                                                       Move<P> move)
        Applies the move move to the state state to generate the new state of the game. Multiple game states may be returned to include information game states for maintaining history. However, the latest or highest-index game state will represent the state of the game after the move was made.

        This method does not check that the given move is a valid move from the current game state.

        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game.
        move - The move that the player chose to make from this position.
        Returns:
        A list of new game states after the given move was made. The list may include historical information game states, and will always include the new state of the game as its last element.

public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
